title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 May 2009 - XWiki

tharindu - (13/05/2009 02:00): sdumitriu: Hi  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 02:00): Hi  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 02:00): How are you?  
tharindu - (13/05/2009 02:01): Fine :) and also Running selenium tests worked with FF3 with the way you proposed,   
tharindu - (13/05/2009 02:03): I am little bit slow with the work because of other works :( but I will work in week ends. How about other GSOC work?  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 02:03): WDYM?  
tharindu - (13/05/2009 02:04): I meant about the student project idea you proposed  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 02:05): Well, I'm a bit unhappy with the selected students  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 02:05): They don't bond very much  
tharindu - (13/05/2009 02:07): but they would get involved more once development period gets start I think  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 02:07): Yes, I hope so  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 02:07): But the bonding is really important  
tharindu - (13/05/2009 02:09): mm yep I also agree with you. hopefully we would get their support more soon  
cypromis\_ left at 02:19 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
tharindu\_ joined #xwiki at 02:35  
tharindu left at 02:37 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 04:00): sdumitriu: Hi, can you tell a little about why packages are named like com.xpn..... in core and org.xwiki in other components like observation  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 04:00): Well, at first there was com.xpn  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 04:00): xpn comes from the old name of the company that created XWiki (XPertNet)  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 04:01): But now we're moving to org.xwiki, to better reflect the project  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 04:01): Since the site is at xwiki.org  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 04:02): ah ok, I was just interested to know about it :) thanks  
ChathuraPrabuddh joined #xwiki at 04:14  
sdumitriu left at 04:46 ("Leaving.")  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:25): tharindu\_u: i  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:25): :hi  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:26): hi  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:26): arunreddy\_\_: hi, I just saw your message now  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:32): hey  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:32): you got the selenium tests working with ff3 ?  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:32): yep  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:33): nice, can you tell me how in brief.  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:33): You can keep FF3 and do following   
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:33): Edit selenium-tests/pom.xml and search for selenium-maven-plugin  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:33): And change with 1.0-rc-1  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:34): ok  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:34): thats it .?  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:34): add firefox-bin path like this  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:34): <browser>\*firefox /home/tharindu/Public/Software/firefox3/firefox-bin</browser>  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:34): then it should work like this  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:35): mvn install -Dpattern=LoginLogoutTest  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:35): name of your test  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:35): thanks. got it. i have already written couple of selenium tests  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:35): I think we should not add pom.xml changes in the patch  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:35): but that time was forced to use firefox2   
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:36): mcn have you written tests with groovy and velocity  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:36): I have few confusions there  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:36): nope  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:37): k mcn, I am trying to figure it out. when I get some free time I have to finish it, probably this week end :)  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:37): plz dont mind .. mcn ??  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:38): oops sorry its a local term used when chatting with friends. like man or something :(  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:38): Anyways good luck. and have a nice time.  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:38): cool. maxa. ( Learnt from chatura)  
tharindu\_ - (13/05/2009 05:39): you too. I think he has told you some more ;)  
arunreddy\_\_ - (13/05/2009 05:40): hmm :)

vmassol - (13/05/2009 08:39): arunreddy: I don't know. have you checked the source code?  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 08:40): arunreddy: ok just checked the source (XWikiDocument) and found http://rafb.net/p/kgkijU94.html  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 08:40): so that's your answer  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 08:40): thanks

lucien - (13/05/2009 11:59): Hi folks,  
lucien - (13/05/2009 11:59): I intend to set up an annotation feature enabled xwiki (in order to allow anyone test),  
lucien - (13/05/2009 11:59): I need to add two jars, modify xwiki.cfg and web.xml  
lucien - (13/05/2009 11:59): can I use myxwiki.org or do I have to use a new virtual server ?  
arkub left at 12:09 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
jvdrean - (13/05/2009 12:15): lucien: since we're using myxwiki to deploy stuff like watch or mockups I think it's ok to use it to test annotations  
jvdrean - (13/05/2009 12:15): what do the others think ?  
marta\_ joined #xwiki at 12:19  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 12:22): marta\_ : Hi  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 12:23): jvdrean: I think it's useful if 1) it's working well already and 2) lucien is interested by getting feedback from xwiki community  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 12:23): s/jvdrean/jvdrean and lucien/  
marta\_ - (13/05/2009 12:24): hi arunreddy  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 12:25): lucien: I think it would be nice if you send an email on the devs list too to explain what you have, what we need to do to integrate it   
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 12:25): hi, i have a fix for jira xwiki-3468.   
vmassol - (13/05/2009 12:25): lucien: for me this would be a prereqs before putting it on myxwiki.org  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 12:25): have to change some code in macros.vm   
vmassol - (13/05/2009 12:25): lucien: in general you need to communicate more on the mailing list I think  
lucien - (13/05/2009 12:26): ok  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 12:26): marta\_ : how do i write a test case for it. Should i write a selenium test.  
marta\_ - (13/05/2009 12:27): yes, that would be nice...  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 12:29): Do you have any idea whether there are any tests written for document information tab. at the bottom.  
marta\_ - (13/05/2009 12:34): i'm not sure if there are or not, sorry...   
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 12:37  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 12:37): ok, Thanks

jvelociter - (13/05/2009 13:49): lucien: jvdrean for me it's ok too  
jvelociter - (13/05/2009 13:49): xwiki.cfg and web.xml are already twicked  
jvelociter - (13/05/2009 13:49): but we should still be careful to not affect perf  
jvelociter - (13/05/2009 13:50): otherwise myxwiki.org will be a wrong indicator  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 13:57): jvelociter: that's one reason I'd like more info on the devs list  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 13:58): + the fact that it's of no use to have that feature if it cannot be integrated in XE in some way (so we need to know how it is done and what's the plan)  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 13:59): basically do some peer reviewing  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 13:59): it's been done as black box dev which isn't very good  
jvelociter - (13/05/2009 14:01): vmassol: from the community yes  
jvelociter - (13/05/2009 14:02): we've exchanged internally with lucien, Ludo and Fabio  
jvelociter - (13/05/2009 14:02): but I agree  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 14:02): well I'm also community

vmassol - (13/05/2009 14:02): :)

jvelociter - (13/05/2009 14:03): :D  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 14:03): that's why co-working is bad, it creates seggregation ;)

asyd - (13/05/2009 16:53): well, it's almost true, isn't it?  
jvelociter - (13/05/2009 16:53): yes it's quite true  
jvelociter - (13/05/2009 16:54): even more if we consider that writing code is preparing a release...  
asyd - (13/05/2009 16:54): :)  
asyd - (13/05/2009 16:54): indeed

vmassol - (13/05/2009 16:59): asyd: watch isn't dead  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 16:59): and yes it's very good for that

vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:02): http://planet.apache.org/  
asyd - (13/05/2009 17:02): planet.opensolaris.org for example :)  
asyd - (13/05/2009 17:02): blogs aggregations

vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:02): I still have the plan to move it to news.xwiki.org and advertise it

vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:02): with lucaa  :)

asyd - (13/05/2009 17:03): :)  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:04): since some apis have changed, she'll be ensuring all work fine  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:04): shouldn't be long  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:04): lucaa: any planning for this?  
lucaa - (13/05/2009 17:04): yes gang, watch trunk on 1.8.1 is loading, please wait  
lucaa - (13/05/2009 17:04): ftm I'm in trouble with jetty  
asyd - (13/05/2009 17:04): I notice you have a pretty new employe :)

lucaa - (13/05/2009 17:05): since things have changed in that part since 1.5...  
lucaa - (13/05/2009 17:05): vmassol: I'll be on that tomorrow and probably in the weekend too

vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:05): lucaa: ok great, do you plan to release a new version when you're done?  
lucaa - (13/05/2009 17:06): vmassol: I could release the trunk as a 1.1 M2  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:06): asyd:yes correct   
vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:06): she's helping us a lot on design  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 17:06): asyd: Or our girls are pretty

asyd - (13/05/2009 17:06): my ex comes from romania  
asyd - (13/05/2009 17:06): maybe my next employer will be xwiki :p  
asyd - (13/05/2009 17:06): s/ex/exgirlfriend/  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:07): lucaa: yes I think it would be rgeat to release something  
jvelociter - (13/05/2009 17:07): asyd: Caty is a star already : http://tinyurl.com/dbmp9y  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:07): since there haven't been any release for a long time  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 17:07): I agree with your plan

Enygma` left at 17:16 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
lxming left at 17:28 ()  
rrodriguez left at 17:46 ()  
cypromis left at 18:11 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 18:12): vmassol: I'd like to close XWIKI-1813 as wontfix  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 18:12): With the new FullScreen this provides little value  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:19): sdumitriu: I don't think we should close it, it's different  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:19): it's about offering the maximal space normal mode  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:20): if you haver a large screen it's quite easy to see the wasted space  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:20): full screen is a pain  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:20): you need to click full scree button, then you don't see the navigation on the side, etc  
KermitTheFragger left at 18:20 ("Leaving")  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:20): if you have a large screen it's because you want to use it   
mflorea left at 18:20 ("Leaving")  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:21): mine for ex is large enough to have both a large viewport \*and\* the normal UI  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:21): (1920x1200)  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:21): it's not too bad but I could see 20% more of vertical space  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:21): also on small screen it must be bad  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:22): since they can't see all the default vertical space  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:22): and they have to scroll I guess  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:22): so they have 2 scrolls  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:22): one for the viewport and one for the content itself if it's larger than the viewport  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 18:23): OK, how do you suggest to do it? Javascript?  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:23): technically I have no idea but yes I guess JS  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:24): is it possible in JS to get the viewable screen size?  
vmassol - (13/05/2009 18:24): apparently yes: http://www.pageresource.com/jscript/jscreen.htm  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 18:25): Yes, it is  
lucien left at 18:43 ("Leaving.")

jvdrean left at 19:30 ()  
tuska left at 19:32 ("Ex-Chat")  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 19:46  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 19:47): sdumitriu : around ?  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:47): Yes  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 19:48): i want to cross check. the fix is " making sure that the same document doesnt get repeated in the list of back links "  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:49): Yes  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 19:49): how to write the selenium test for the same.  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:50): Exactly what you would do  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:50): Open administration  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:50): Set multilingual  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:50): save the document in 3 languages  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:50): each with a link  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:51): open the linked document  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:51): check the backlinks  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 19:51): ok   
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:51): then delete the document and reset the wiki to monolingual in a final block  
sdumitriu - (13/05/2009 19:51): finally  
arunreddy - (13/05/2009 19:52): thats it ?
